make_for_me.description: Requests for fully-developed content (e.g., problems, quizzes, essays, poems, images) within well-defined parameters; user engages ChatGPT as a task executor.

find_for_me.description: Informational requests seeking pre-existing, factual information (e.g., existing facts, quotes, resources, or examples); user engages ChatGPT as a search engine.

jumpstart_for_me.description: Requests to initiate the development of often-lengthy and complex materials like activities, projects, lessons, or unit plans; user engages ChatGPT as a catalyst.

iterate_with_me.description: Requests for advice, or to understand/refine/re-think concepts or teaching approaches; user engages ChatGPT as a sounding board like they would a teaching colleague. Additionally, these prompts are often identifiable by words like “explain,” “discuss,” or “describe.”
